result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. McKenzie P Paisley

records.addlTxt: No contact with any Walmarts or Verizon Stores in the US. No contact with MGM or their residence.

11:32 AM Defendant McKenzie P Paisley appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Robert James Shane appeared by video for McKenzie P Paisley.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Time set for P/S.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  DE will enter into a DAGP on Ct 1 for a 2 year period, comply with all conditions as listed on the agreement.  Ct's 2,3 will be DRI.  Court has colloquy with DE on his right to personal appearance, DE will waive personal appearance for today.  DAGP fee has been paid.  

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court  notes plea of NC, will hold in abeyance for a 2 year period.  DE will comply with all conditions as listed on the DAGP.  

Bond motion- DE currently has a $7500.00 cash bond, Atty asking the court to amend the cash bond to a $5000.00 sign bond, argument as to why.  No objection from the State.  Court will amend bond to a $5000.00 sign bond.  Adj 11:46am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:30 AM Defendant McKenzie P Paisley appeared by video from RC Jail.  Attorney Robert James Shane appeared by video for McKenzie P Paisley.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Atty Shane informs the court that an agreement has been reached in the matter, DE would be entering into a DAGP. DA Anderson addresses the DAGP fee and restitution that would be required with agreement. Hearing has been set for Arraignment, State has victim Witness notification to comply with.  State asks for 5 days in the event that victim notification would need to be mailed. Set for P/S 9/06/22 @ 11:30 ZOOM.  DE/Atty will waive personal appearance, hearing will be via zoom.  Atty Shane would like argument entered on plea so DE may be released and return to MI with his mother.  State objects, victim rights.  Adj 11:42am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 020748,
Payable Number: 48676,
Receipt Number: 22R 002190,
Amount: $20.00
DE REFUSED TO SIGN CASH BOND.

1:40 PM Defendant McKenzie P Paisley appeared by video from RC jail.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Robert Shane appears for DE. Waive formal reading of the CC. Bond has been set.  DE/Atty will waive the right to PH.  Court instructs on waiver of PH, DE makes waiver knowingly, freely and voluntarily, Set for Arraignment September 2, 2022 @ 9:00am. ZOOM.
BOND CAME BACK AS REFUSED TO SIGN

8:32 AM Defendant Mckenzie P Paisley appeared by video.  Attorney Laurie Osberg from PD office appeared via video.   ADA Emily Nelson appeared in person.   Matter set for Bond Hearing.   Court addressed a PC statement and found PC for the arrest w/out a warrant.       State argued for $7500 cash bond with conditions of no contact with all Walmarts, all Verizons, J.S. and M.M. or their residences.   Attorney Osberg informed Court DE does qualify for PD representation and provided background to Court on DE.   Attorney Osberg argued for $1000 cash bond if not a signature bond.      Court ORDERED $7500 cash bond with conditions DE have no contact with any Walmarts in US, any Verizon stores in the US, J.S., M.M., or their residences.    INIT set for 8/2/22 at 1:00 PM.  Adj. 8:38 AM
No contact with any Walmarts and Verizons in the US.  No contact with JS, MM or their residences.  Set for Initial Appearance August 2, 2022
